nodes.bodyText:
all of this could be
static <T> T nullOr(String name, Object o, Class<T> clazz)

See https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/extra/generics/methods.html
Should I call this ...EventImpl? Analyze Step is mad at me for keeping the same name

we should mark all methods coming from interface with @Override (so that compiler can catch changes).
See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/212614/should-we-override-an-interfaces-method-implementation
We can also use {@inheritDoc} to not repeat javadocs.
This applies to other places so I won't repeat this there.
Another fun note is Javadoc will walk the hierarchy tree if a method is annotated with @Override and doesn't have Javadocs to use parent Javadocs (won't use them if the parent class is Object).
@alzimmermsft There's a rule in checkstyle to catch Override thing - could you guys enable it ?
Should be easy to add, I'll file an issue for this as it may trigger a lot of new exceptions.
If these are used across various models then they should exist in separate class. For example ChangeFeedModelValidator or something like that.
Mind adding @Override to the implementation methods.
Should these static helpers go into a separate utility class? These may be related to BlobChangefeedEvent but they also feel very standalone.
